gw.api.rest.exceptions

Class RestAuthenticationException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • gw.api.rest.exceptions.RestRequestException
            • gw.api.rest.exceptions.RestExceptionWithErrorInfo
              • gw.api.rest.exceptions.RestAuthenticationException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasErrorInfo, java.io.Serializable

    public class RestAuthenticationException
extends RestExceptionWithErrorInfo
    This exception indicates an authentication failure, which will be reported back to the client with a 401 Unauthorized status code.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • translateException

        public static RestAuthenticationException translateException(javax.security.auth.login.LoginException e)
        Translates a LoginException into a RestAuthenticationException. This mechanism is somewhat pluggable. The code will first look for display keys of the form Java.REST.Runtime.Auth.[ExceptionSimpleClassName].[User|Developer]Message For example, if a FailedLoginException is thrown, this method will look for the keys Java.REST.Runtime.Auth.FailedLoginException.UserMessage Java.REST.Runtime.Auth.FailedLoginException.DeveloperMessages If those keys are not found, the messages will default to: Java.REST.Runtime.Auth.OtherAuthFailure.DeveloperMessage Java.REST.Runtime.Auth.OtherAuthFailure.UserMessage The display keys are always passed the message from the exception as an argument, though it need not be used by the display keys
